CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 6, 1954, pg. 30 reads: "Dance To Aid Polio Drive - Teen-age members of Hill City's Welfare Department and their friends held a dance at the Centre Avenue YMCA last Friday and with the proceeds presented a $50 check to the National Foundation for the Prevention of Infantile Paralysis. The committee in charge of the affair is shown in the bottom photo.  Among them are Carolyn Scott, senior adviser; Mary Strother [Strothers], Shirley Murphy, Delores Plair, Virginia Jefferson, Howard Hackley, Priscilla Ward, Alma Bowles, George Phillips, supervisor; Mairbeth Jones, William Tatum, Larry Watson, Pronty L. Ford, senior adviser; John A. Cundieff, assistant director; Charles Norris, Clifford Pillows, Wallace Walker, and Mrs. Eunice Cook, assistant director, who also represents the polio drive staff in the HIll District. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of members of Hill City's Welfare Department, including John A. Cundieff, second from left, Priscilla Ward, fourth from left, Mary Strothers, standing behind Eunice Cook in center; and Pronty L. Ford, second from right wearing striped suit, in Centre Avenue YMCA
